definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: The community's electronic eye has left the thieves nowhere to hide.
sentences.chinese: 社区电子眼，令小偷小摸无处遁形。

sentences.english: The CCD is the digital camera's electronic eye.
sentences.chinese: 而CCD就是数码相机的电子眼。

sentences.english: If we set up more electric eyes on the road, less accidents will happen.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们在路上设更多电子眼，将会发生更少事故。

sentences.english: Bomb disposal robots can look at suspect packages with their cameras.
sentences.chinese: 炸弹解决机器人能经过它们的电子眼发觉疑惑的包袱。

definition: traffic camera/speed camera/closed-circuit TV police surveillance
to break the rules/to violate regulations
to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
to exceed the speed limit/to speed/high-speed
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
